area.key: The total number of indexable nodes, according to the current Full Text Search config
All indexable nodes has full text content in index
The total number of indexed nodes searchable by Full Text Search
The total number of missing indexed nodes, according to the current Full Text Search config
{0} node(s) are missing full text content in index
The total number of indexed nodes that should not be indexed according to the current Full Text Search config
{0} node(s) are incorrectly indexed with full text content
Select whether or not to reindex all nodes
The type of search to perform.
Adds field names to use for title properties. Note, that this overrides the config setting, so you need to add all wanted fields for titles here.
Set the boosting value for the title properties, to make titles more important than body text when searching.
Adds field names to use for body properties. Note, that this overrides the config setting, so you need to add all wanted fields for bodytext here.
Adds field names to use for summary properties. Note, that if you don't specify any summary properties, the body properties will be used instead.
Sets the summary length in the results. The default is 300 characters.
With this setting, you can limit search results to be descendants of the selected nodes.
This is used to define which culture to search in. You should probably always set this, but it might work without it, in invariant sites.
This enables or disables use of wildcards in the search terms. Wildcard characters are added automatically to each of the terms.
Fuzzyness is used to match your search term with similar words. This method sets the fuzzyness parameter of the search. The default is 0.8. If wildcards is enabled, fuzzyness will not be used.
